<img src="http://eums.eusa.ed.ac.uk/wp-content/uploads/images/w620/posters/20110513_summer.jpg" alt="" width="620" height="877" /></a>

The Edinburgh University Music Society's famous Summer Concert takes place on Friday the 13th, where we showcase all three of our ensembles under the same roof. Come and witness a programme of epic proportions!

This year we will be performing no fewer than six pieces, ranging from Respighi's Pines of Rome</em> to Chilcott's Little Jazz Mass.</em>

The EPIC programme for the night will be:

Bliss </strong>Antiphonal Fanfares For Three Brass Choirs</p>

Vaughan Williams </strong>English Folk Song Suite</p>

Moeran </strong>Overture to a Masque</p>

Macmillan </strong>So Deep</p>

Chilcott </strong>A Little Jazz Mass</p>

Bruckner </strong>Locus Iste</p>

Rachmaninoff </strong>Bogoroditse Djevo</p>

Respighi </strong>Pines of Rome</p>
Doors open at 7pm, and it is recommended that you arrive early to ensure that you are not disappointed!
